ability.name: Electromagnetic Power
ability.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may take 1 Energy card attached to 1 of your Magnemites, Magnetons, or Dark Magnetons and attach it to a different 1 of your Magnemites, Magnetons, or Dark Magnetons. This power can't be used if Magneton is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Plasma
attacks.text: If there are any Energy cards in your discard pile, attach 1 of them to Magneton.

ability.name: Legendary Body
ability.text: As long as Raikou is your Active Pokémon, Raikou and Energy cards attached to it aren't affected by effects from Trainer cards other than Trainer cards other than Stadium cards. As long as this power is active, discard all Trainer cards attached to Raikou. (This power works even if Raikou is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.)

attacks.name: Lightning Spark
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 of them and this attack does 20 damage to it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Fury Attack
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Skarmory.

attacks.name: Earthquake
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each of your own Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Rock Tumble
attacks.text: Don't apply Resistance.

attacks.name: Mysterious Powder
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Gold Scale
attacks.text: Your opponent may draw 2 cards. Either way, you may draw 2 cards.

attacks.name: Dragon Bond
attacks.text: Search your deck for a card named Gyarados, Dark Gyarados, or Shining Gyarados. Show it to your opponent and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Take Down
attacks.text: Swinub does 10 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Poison Spray
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

cards.name: Healing Field
text: Once during each player's turn, he or she may flip a coin. If heads, that player removes 2 damage counters from his or her Active Pokémon (1 if it only has 1).

cards.name: Rocket's Hideout
text: Each Pokémon in play with Dark in its name (even your opponent's) gets +20 HP.

ability.name: Howl
ability.text: When you play Entei from your hand, you may discard the top 5 cards from your deck. (if you have fewer cards in your deck than that, discard all of them.) If any of those are Fire Energy cards, attach them to any of your Fire Pokémon of your choice. Using this power ends your turn.

attacks.name: Searing Flames
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy cards attached to Entei or this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Stoke
attacks.text: You may search your deck for a Energy card and attach it to Ho-oh

attacks.name: Sacred Fire
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 40 damage to that Pokémon. Don't apply Weakness and Resistance.

attacks.name: Dive Bomb
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

ability.name: Lightning Burst
ability.text: Whenever you attach a Lightning Energy card from your hand to Raikou, if your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, he or she chooses 1 of them and switches it with the Defending Pokémon. This power stops working while Raikou is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Lightning Tackle
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, Raikou does 20 damage to itself.

ability.name: Crystal Body
ability.text: Prevent all effects of your opponent's attacks, other than damage, done to Suicune. This power stops working while Suicune is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Aurora Wave
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If both are heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed. If only 1 is heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Rainbow Burn
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage plus 10 more for each type of Basic Energy card if any, attached to Ho-oh

attacks.name: Aerowing
attacks.text: You may flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 80 damage. If tails, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Thundershock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Lightning Strike
attacks.text: You may discard all Energy cards attached to Raichu. If you do, this attack does 80 damage.

ability.name: Mimic
ability.text: As long as Sudowoodo is your Active Pokémon, it copies all of the Defending Pokémon's attacks, including their costs. This power can't be used if Sudowoodo is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: (20x) Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Tail Shock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Sleep Pinchers
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

ability.name: [Yield]
ability.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a Psychic Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Pokémon with Unown in its name. Shuffle your deck afterward. This power can be used even if Unown is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Grab
attacks.text: Choose a Trainer card attached to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. Your opponent shuffles that card into his or her deck.

attacks.name: Whirlpool
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has any Energy cards attached to it, choose 1 of them and discard it.

attacks.name: Poison Sting
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Needle Storm
attacks.text: (20x) Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads you get.

attacks.name: Sharpshooting
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. Don't apply Weakness and Resistance.

attacks.name: Bubblebeam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

ability.name: [Keep]
ability.text: Your opponent's attacks, Pokémon Powers, and Trainer cards can't discard Energy cards from your Pokémon with Unown in their names. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)

ability.name: Softboiled
ability.text: When you play Blissey from your hand, you may flip a coin. If heads, remove 8 damage counters from Blissey. If tails, remove 4 damage counters from Blissey. Either way, if Blissey has fewer damage counters than that, remove all of them.

attacks.name: Body Slam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

ability.name: Time Travel
ability.text: If an opponent's attack would Knock Out Celebi, flip a coin. If heads, Celebi is not Knocked Out and you shuffle it and all cards attached to it into your deck. This power doesn't work if Celebi is already Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Psychic Damage
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. For each heads, put 1 damage counter on the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Present
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. If exactly 1 is heads, this attack does 40 damage. If exactly 2 are heads, remove 3 damage counters from the Defending Pokémon. If the Defending Pokémon has fewer damage counters than that, remove all of them. If all 3 are heads, this attack does 60 damage. If all 3 are tails, remove all damage counters from the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dark Flame
attacks.text: Discard 1 Energy card attached to Houndoom or this attack does nothing. If there are any Energy cards in your discard pile, attach 1 of them to Houndoom.

attacks.name: Black Fang
attacks.text: Flip a number of coins equal to the number of Energy attached to Houndoom. This attack does 30 damage plus 10 more damage for each heads.

ability.name: Energy Converter
ability.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may choose 1 Basic Energy card attached to 1 of your Pokémon and choose an Energy type. Treat that Energy card as that type until the end is your turn. This power can't be used if Porygon2 is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed. If Porygon2 becomes Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed, the Energy card goes back to its original type.

attacks.name: Delta Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose whether the Defending Pokémon becomes Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

ability.name: Prehistoric Memory
ability.text: Whenever an Evolved Pokémon attacks (even if it's your opponent's), it can use any attack from its Basic card or any Evolution card attached to it. It still has to pay for that attack's Energy cost. This power stops working while Aerodactyl is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Fly
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Aerodactyl. If tails, this attack does nothing (not even damage).

attacks.name: Psychic Leaf
attacks.text: Flip a coin for each Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each heads. Remove a number of damage counters from Celebi equal to the damage done to the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance). If Celebi has fewer damage counters than that, remove all of them.

ability.name: Legendary Body
ability.text: As long as Entei is your Active Pokémon, Entei and Energy cards attached to it aren't affected by effects from Trainer cards other than Trainer cards other than Stadium cards. As long as this power is active, discard all Trainer cards attached to Entei. (This power works even if Entei is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.)

attacks.name: Mega Flame
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. For each tails, discard 1 Energy card from Entei, if it has any.

attacks.name: Genetic Memory
attacks.text: Use any attack from Kingdra's Basic Pokémon card or Evolution card. (Kingdra doesn't have to pay for that attack's Energy cost.)

attacks.name: Twister
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. For each heads, choose an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon, if any, and discard it. If both are tails, this attack does nothing (not even damage).

attacks.name: Swipe
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard all Trainer cards attached to your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Core Stream
attacks.text: Choose an Energy type other than . This attack does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon with any Energy cards of that type attached to it. Don't apply Weakness and Resistance.

ability.name: Legendary Body
ability.text: As long as Suicune is your Active Pokémon, Suicune and Energy cards attached to it aren't affected by effects from Trainer cards other than Trainer cards other than Stadium cards. As long as this power is active, discard all Trainer cards attached to Suicune. (This power works even if Suicune is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.)

attacks.name: Crystal Wave
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 10 more damage. If tails, this attack does 30 damage and, if your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, he or she chooses 1 of them and switches it with the Defending Pokémon. (Do the damage before switching the Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Freezing Kiss Goodnight
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Strange Dance
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage and the Defending Pokémon is now Confused. If tails, this attack does 20 damage.

ability.name: Submerge
ability.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may change Lanturn's type to Water until the end of your turn. This power can't be used if Lanturn is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed. If Lanturn becomes Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed after you have used this power, its type changes back to Lightning.

attacks.name: Blinding Light
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Nap
attacks.text: Remove 3 damage counters from Piloswine. If it has fewer damage counters than that, remove all of them.

attacks.name: High-Speed Charge
attacks.text: Piloswine does 30 damage to itself. Piloswine can't use this attack during your next turn.

attacks.name: Terrorize
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is a Basic, choose 1 of its attacks. That Pokémon can't use that attack during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Overhead Toss
attacks.text: If you have any Benched Pokémon, flip a coin. If tails, this attack does 10 damage to 1 of them. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

ability.name: [Bear]
ability.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may move 1 damage counter from 1 of your Pokémon with Unown in its name to Unown . This power can't be used if Unown has 10 HP left. This power can be used even if Unown is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Positive Ion
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage. If tails, this attack does 10 damage.

attacks.name: Negative Ion
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon attacks Chinchou during your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Chinchou is reduced by 10 (before applying Weakness and Resistance). (Benching either Pokémon ends this effect.)

attacks.name: Fin Smack
attacks.text: (10x) Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for a card named Murkrow and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward. (You can't use this attack if your Bench is full.)

attacks.name: Flock Attack
attacks.text: Flip a number of coins equal to the number of Murkrows on your Bench. This attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Sleep Spore
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

ability.name: Hard Shell
ability.text: Whenever an attack (including your own) does 40 or less damage to Shuckle (after applying Weakness and Resistance), reduce that damage to 10. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.) This power stops working while Shuckle is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Toxic Saliva
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. It now takes 20 Poison damage after each player's turn (even if it was already Poisoned).

attacks.name: Magma Ring
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

cards.name: Smoochum
text: If this Baby Pokémon is your Active Pokémon and your opponent tries to attack, your opponent flips a coin (before doing anything else required in order to use that attack). If tails, your opponent's turn ends without an attack.

attacks.name: Psykiss
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose a Special Energy card attached to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. Your opponent shuffles that card into his or her deck.

attacks.name: Raging Headbutt
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 damage times the number of damage counters on Snubbull. If tails, this attack does 10 damage.

attacks.name: Outrage
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Shining Gyarados. If tails, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Devastate
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy cards attached to Shining Gyarados or this attack does nothing. This attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Then, flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 Energy card attached to each of your opponent's Pokémon that has any Energy cards attached to it and discard those Energy cards.

cards.name: Balloon Berry
text: When the Pokémon Balloon Berry is attached to retreats, discard Balloon Berry instead of discarding Energy cards.

attacks.name: Attract Current
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. For each heads, you may search your deck for a L Energy card and attach it to 1 of your L Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Gigavolt
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage. If tails, this attack does 40 damage and the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Triggered Poison
attacks.text: If your opponent attaches an Energy card to the Defending Pokémon during his or her next turn, that Pokémon becomes Poisoned.

attacks.name: Cross Attack
attacks.text: (20x) Flip 4 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads. If you get 2 or more heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Evolutionary Spore
attacks.text: Choose any number of your Hoppips and Skiplooms. Then, for each Pokémon you chose in this way, you may search your deck for a card that evolves from that Pokémon and attach it to that Pokémon. (This counts as evolving those Pokémon.) Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Night Eyes
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Perish Song
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is Asleep, and was attacked with Night Eyes during your last turn, it is Knocked Out.

attacks.name: Screech
attacks.text: Until the end of your next turn, if an attack damages the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance), that attack does 20 more damage to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Poison Bite
attacks.text: If this attack damages the Defending Pokémon, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned and you remove a number of damage counters from Golbat equal to half that damage (rounded up to the nearest 10). If Golbat has fewer damage counters than that, remove all of them. Either way, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

ability.name: Magma Pool
ability.text: If Magcargo is your Active Pokémon and moves to the Bench, remove 1 Fire Energy card attached to Magcargo, if any, and attach it to the new Active Pokémon. (You can't use an Energy card that you used to pay for the Retreat Cost.)

attacks.name: Lava Flow
attacks.text: You may discard any number of Energy cards attached to Magcargo when you use this attack. If you do, this attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage for each Energy card you discarded in this way.

attacks.name: Constrict
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Octazooka
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, whenever the Defending Pokémon attacks, your opponent flips a coin. If tails that attack does nothing. (Benching or evolving that Pokémon ends this effect.)

attacks.name: Rising Lunge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage. If tails, this attack does 10 damage.

attacks.name: Horn Swipe
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If both are heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 40 more damage. If 1 or both are tails, this attack does 20 damage.

attacks.name: Leek Jab
attacks.text: This attack can't be used during your next turn. (Benching Farfetch'd ends this effect.)

cards.name: Pokemon Breeder Fields
text: Flip a coin for each of your non-Baby Pokémon that can evolve. For each heads, search your deck for a later-Stage card that matches that Pokémon. Then put that card into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterwards.

cards.name: Old Rod
text: Flip 2 coins. If both are heads, put a Baby Pokémon, Basic, or Evolution card from your discard pile into your hand. If both are tails, put a Trainer card from your discard pile into your hand.
